result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel T. Stevens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Samuel T. Stevens is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Samuel T. Stevens was found guilty of OWI (3rd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.
*   Pay fine of $650 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, to be returned to Judge for enforcement.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
DE shall ot drive w/o valid DL.  DOC shall promptly notify the Court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

from DOC requesting clarification of the probationary term on count 1.
Amended for KCJ time until 11-8-16 due to probation violations.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Catherine Lambrechts.  Agent Debra Adams present.  Deft sentenced to the KCJ until 11/8/16 as a condition of probation due to his violations.
Atty Catherine Lambrechts
Case set for RH on 10/6/16 @ 1:30pm based on letter from P&P (9/20/16).  Email sent to DA's office, PD's office, & Agent Debra Adams along w/date & time of hrg
from Agent Debra Adams - deft signed an ATR agreeing to 60 days conditional jail time
Associated with Charge #1
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

ADA Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. DE in custody with Atty. X. Solis. Clerk RMM
No dispute to Presentence report. Victim Rights copliant.
Plea of guilty entered and accepted by the court. 
Sentencing arguments heard. Sentence withheld. Probation for 2 years. 36 days  Jail, with no credit. DE shall not drive w/o valid Drivers License.
No work crew allowed.
27 month Drivers License suspension and interlock device ordered. 
Fine $650 plus costs to be paid within terms of probation or to be returned to this Court for enforcement.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Xavier Solis.  Case is resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  Deft pleads guilty to count 1; found guilty by the Court.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 3/23/16 @ 11am.  Count 2 is dismissed on State's motion.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Xavier Solis.  Defense counsel reports the case is resolved; requests plea/sentencing date.  Court will adjourn this one time; plea/sentencing set for 2/10/16 @ 10:30am
